rComments: awful!! it seems like she is too scared to even speak. she makes way too many mistakes. all her lectures are just regurgitating her slides. her exams are the same; regurgitate her slides. it feels like everything you learn in class won't matter at all. and her exams are so hard!! your gonna be riding the curves throughout the class!!

What a great professor. Super clear lectures if you listen at all. I didn't go to class because 100B is super easy if you enjoy Macroeconomics, but when I did I was really impressed with her ability to explain material quickly and clearly. Also wickedly smart chick you can tell if you talk Econ with her for 5 min

Many students do not like Johanna because the class is hard, but to be fair it isn't her fault. The material covered in class goes by fast so it is helpful to read the textbook before lecture and go to section. Lectures are helpful although dry at times.  There is also a giant curve.

Professor Francis is a very dry and bland teacher. She speaks in such a soft voice and honestly its really hard to understand her. She makes mistakes on midterms and didn't tell students that she messed up until halfway through the midterm causing students to redo half the midterm. The TA's know more than her I highly suggest MSI or sections.

Lots of people saying she messes up and stuff, but i've never seen that. Her class can be pretty dry when she goes over examples for 2 hours but she knows what she is talking about and answers questions thoroughly and helpfully. her lectures are closely tied to the book and the homeworks and tests are taken straight from class material and the book

Johanna does not speak with any confidence which makes you doubt her genuine knowledge of the material. Class is good for going through examples (if she doesn't mess them up) but I learned the most from taking thorough notes on her lecture slides online and going to section.

Prof. Francis is one of the worst prof I've had. She doesn't teach anything of substance during lecture. Basically goes over theory that you'll never need to know. Also messes up on examples 95% of the time. Lectures like a 6th grader giving a mandatory speech for the first time.

class is straight forward, clear, and easy to understand. go to class, listen in lecture, read the book and practice everything and you should get an A. if you dont, you will definitely struggle.  i recommend her. go to her office hours to get the best results

best teacher i ever had. very clear and straight-forward. makes things easy to understand. puts in the effort to go the extra mile to help students. provides a ton of extra resources. midterm and final are based off of the reviews. even if you dont do you're homework, you will still receive credit.

Who the H wrote that review? AVOID! I honestly do not think she knows what she is doing. Doesn't really lecture, just reads of slides,without explaining. Tests are ridiculous. Whatever shows up on the tests is usually neither on the slides nor in the homework. A ton of people dropped during the first few weeks. DOESN'T allow calculators on tests.

Very kind and cares about students. Go to lecture, she does a great job of explaining material. The material is not easy but she does her best to help and doesn't try to screw you over on tests like other profs. Only downside is that she tends to talk a lot about details that you don't really need to know but are interesting nonetheless.
